roleset.name: fear a lot
roleset.note: DREAD-V NOTES: Frames file for 'dread' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 31.2, Framenet entry Experiencer subj. (from dread.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: adjectival
example.text: I guess we're all living very tentatively here, waiting for the expected but dreaded aftershock.

example.name: verbal
example.text: John dreads coming home to Mary each night.
example.arg: coming home to Mary each night

roleset.name: generally awful
roleset.note: DREADFUL-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-4,5. Comparison to awful.01. (from dreadful.01-j)

example.name: arg1
example.text: Off on a tangent I quite like all of the Sky commentary team with the exception of David Gower who-1 I think [*-1] is dreadful .

example.name: concatenation of arg1
example.text: It took over a month and Cingular's customer service was absolutely dreadful to deal with.

example.name: both args
example.text: Ainsley's mother, Sophia, while loving, was absolutely dreadful to her own children.

roleset.name: absolutely unskilled at
roleset.note: DREADFUL-J NOTES: Added by Julia,comparison to awful.02. (from dreadful.02-j)

example.name: both args
example.text: James was dreadful at spelling - he got everything wrong.

roleset.name: extremely anti-beneficial, unhealthy
roleset.note: DREADFUL-J NOTES: Added by Julia,comparison to awful.03. (from dreadful.03-j)

example.name: both args
example.text: But i don't know if theres any brands of pop that use it instead of aspartame, which-1 [*-1] is dreadful for you by the way!
